thread.title: Grant names starting line up for tonight's friendly against Canada
thread.title_full: Grant names starting line up for tonight's friendly against Canada

title: Grant names starting line up for tonight's friendly against Canada
text:
22:42 CET Grant names starting line up for tonight's friendly against Canada By Ghana FA 
Coach Avram Grant has named his starting line-up for Ghana's international friendly against Canada at the RFK Stadium in Washington on Tuesday evening. 
The game which forms part of the team's preparations for the upcoming World Cup qualifier against Comoros next month, will see Cordoba goalkeeper Razak Braimah in post for the Black Stars. 
US-based Harrison Afful and Leicester City's Jeffery Schlupp will be on the right and left side of defence respectively while Edwin Gyimah partners John Boye at the heart of defence. 
Emmanuel Agyeman Badu who will be captain of the team today will be in midfield alongside Bernard Mensah, Albert Adomah and Mubarak Wakaso 
Aston Villa striker Jordan Ayew will partner Chicago Fire forward David Accam in attack for the Black Stars. 
The match is scheduled to kick off at 11:30pm(GMT)Below is Ghana XI for the friendly against Canada:Razak Braimah
